data.title: Big Slices!!!
data.text: Huge slices and taste great too, this is a small place not too busy you can get in and out fairly quick the only set back is that the prices are too expensive

data.title: Calzones at Sa'ls
data.text: If your looking for a good calzone Sal's is where you want to go, they are the friendliest people ,they work very hard to keep everything sparkling clean there salads are good size, they even have desserts cookies, brownies,etc.their pizza is also good, my favorite item there is a meatball calzone and their huge!

data.title: Great pizza
data.text: I love this pizza, especially the sauce and all the extras I enjoy.  As much as I enjoy a thick pizza,  this one is great for a thin pizza.

data.title: Good pizza
data.text: Sal's has good pizza, fast service, reasonable price.    We called ahead, 2 pizzas, they were ready in 20 minutes.

data.title: Too much garlic; too much crust
data.text: Although many locals rave about Sal's Pizza, and one certainly gets bang for your buck. I do not care for it. The Pizzas are enormous, so nobody goes away hungry, but the sauce has so much garlic that that is all that you taste. If you are feeding a pack of hungry boys whose taste buds have not yet fully developed, go there. If not, try somewhere else.

data.title: The best pizza I ever had!!
data.text: I really enjoy Sal's Just pizza, their ingredients are always fresh.  I would recommend this Pizza shop to anyone, the pizza's are huge and always crisp.  All the people are so friendly and make sure you're waited on ASAP.  What's unusual is, they give you the updates as your order is being made. Like they'll say, "a couple more minutes mam or we're aliittle backed up, 15 minutes", you don't mind waiting, if you know when the end will be.  They really care about you as a customer, and that's important to me!!!  Go visit them, you'll be suprised!!!!

data.title: The largest pizza around.
data.text: There single slices are enough for any one. The service and the help are great. They are very quick and simply great.

data.title: Quite taken with the massive 19" Pizza
data.text: Located in the old KFC Building, just up the street from the YMCA.  This 19" Pizza is no ordinary Pizza.  We are quite taken with what we affectionately refer to our "Garbage Pizza" which usually consists of Sausage, Meatball, Pepper and Onion.  Generous toppings on a very large pie.  We like the sauce, sweet but not too sweet.  The crust is just right, not too chewy and very tasty.  We also like the price, very fair.  We have dined in and done take out numerous times.  There is a small table area featuring booths, a small area with stools and a high counter and restrooms.  We are pretty focused on Pizza but I have noticed what appears to be fresh looking salads in the display case at the main counter.  Impressed that they seem to keep the place very clean.

data.title: Not so good
data.text: I had better pizza that was frozen. Connolis are filled with cheese no cream. Wouldn't order again but the people were very friendly

data.title: Average
data.text: Lots of crust where the sauce did not cover. A nice chewy texture. Decent prices. Huge portions. A nice bread. Not a thick pizza at all. Different toppings which are good.

data.title: When is a slice not a slice?
data.text: Best deals are the plain cheeses, but if everyone has different tastes, individual slices are the way to go.  By now, everyone knows that when Sal's sells a slice, it's a quarter of a huge pizza; right?  If you don't like thick crust, Sal's is not your place, but i drive past the front doors of seven pizza places to get to Sal's.  they close earlier than i would like, so forget about the late-night munchies.

data.title: Casual Dinning At Its Best!
data.text: Taste just like New York Pizza! The pastry is great !

data.title: Delicious cannolis and eclairs
data.text: We were headed for a Labor Day lobster bake empty handed. We drove by Sa's pizza and noticed the bakery sign. I knew their reputation for pizza was good. We picked up what they had already made for cannoli and eclairs and headed for the party. Everyone raved. The young woman who waited on us offered to make more while we waited. She took pride in the fact that she had made them earlier in the day and promised we would love them. She's an asset! And she was right.
